dict.string: Toyota acquires GM’s interest in Subaru, and the first car the two companies develop together is the Subaru BRZ/Toyota 86/Scion FR-S. The BRZ is the first Subaru since the 360 to be rear-wheel drive. Delightful handling earns the BRZ a place on C/D’s 10Best list, despite the modest power output (200 horsepower) from the boxer four.
